content: why lock here welcome back thanks for joining me I'd like to take you where no
crafting channel has ever gone before or maybe they haven't I just don't know
about it but how about an exercise in meta crafting this is an episode about
how to craft a crafting channel so if you're ready to have your mind blown
I'm ready to turn around this camera all right here we are wcv studios proper and
down here is the chair you need a chair we'll start up here this is a sheet of
cardboard that is taped to the wall and I've hot glued a bunch of stuff to its
shelves and this boom at the top the boom is so that I can do top-down shots
I just place the phone right there and I can go hands-free and do top down the
first shelf has this bracket that I made out of cardboard and the bracket is such
that the the phone sits in it and is tilted at just the right angle to
capture all of the cutting board so that's how I know I've got the right I
guess frame of view on the next shelf down that's where I put the camera
turned around in order to shoot myself doing the kickoffs that's if my chair is
at the lowest setting that I know that it it's at the right height the entire
workbench that I made here is covered with a sheet of cardboard and there's a
couple of marks that indicate where the edge of the cutting board is supposed to
be so I know where the cutting board is in terms of the cameras field of view at
all times and here's my paintbrushes water for rinsing this is the paint rack
I built this about a year ago or so it's held up well
down here the bigger stuff that doesn't fit in it
various Gray's because if you do dungeons you need lots of grays and
different types I've got some homemade flocking here probably not gonna do an
episode on that there's enough of them up there and of course the beer so this
lamp here has a built in like circular table on it so that's where the beer
sits what I wanted to show you this mug my wife got this for me for my birthday
it's got sort of a frosted picture of a dragon and then the words dungeon master
below it but it's a too light setup this is how I get enough light to have a very
strong response from the camera which is again a cheap phone camera and we'll
move over here into the closet area up top is our gift wrapping so I share the
closet over here miscellaneous scraps I try not to let that pile get too big in
this box I've got a couple inserts that have crafted and this is where I just
keep miscellaneous supplies so there's wood on the bottom up here's all like
glitter they're beads that kind of thing once I started the channel I realized in
short order I needed to find a way to stay organized in here popsicle sticks
glass beads this is all the the sand and pebbles that I that you occasionally see
me use and moving on further there's more wall
pieces from the recent castle tiles video pile a chipboard aluminum foil a
couple boxes I actually don't remember what's in these ok the rejects or
experimental tiles they're down below there's more completed tiles that's
stuff they are on the far right here's what's waiting to be sold on Etsy this
is unsorted this is a project that kind of abandoned this box is all my minis
both real and paper mixed together and below that is the big tile storage box
that you've seen before and I'm not gonna go through that here then there's
the game day stuff notepads for all the players tackle box that's what I keep my
dice in and let's head back over and take a look at the editing station this
is my desk and my computer I built this back in I think 2010 it's a space heater
basically here's my microphone this came with my Denon AV receiver and it's used
to level eyes the speaker low settings in that receiver but I use it for very
sound recording so I'll briefly go over my workflow I do all my video capture on
my phone which is a droid turbo and I do my video editing and compiling in Adobe
Premiere Pro 2.0 but the video that my phone makes doesn't work for this
version of Premiere it's pretty old doesn't have h.264 so I use free make
video converter to convert the stuff from my phone so that Premiere can read
it the microphone on my phone is really terrible
so I record audio separately as I showed you my microphone earlier and I do my
audio capture and editing with audacity which is a great free tool and if
there's miscellaneous image editing slideshows that kind of thing I use
Photoshop for odds and ends so that is wcv studios thank you for
joining me I am why lock and I will see you next time
